bill_title: allow six member juries in civil actions.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow six member juries in civil actions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 15-14-27 be amended to read as follows: 15-14-27. In all civil actions cognizable by a magistrate judge , except actions for the forcible entry and detainer, or detainer only, of real property, or tried in the circuit court, the jury shall consist of six jurors. The verdict may be rendered by five-sixths of the jury in the manner provided in § § 15-14-28 and 15-14-29. However the parties may stipulate that the jury may consist of a number greater than six but not more than twelve pursuant to § 15-6-48. Section 2. That § 15-6-48 be amended to read as follows: 15-6-48. The parties may stipulate that the jury shall consist of any number less than greater than six but not more than twelve or that a verdict or a finding of a stated majority of the jurors shall be taken as the verdict or finding of the jury. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
